title: Is Warren Buffett's $2.9 Billion Bet and Sales of Biggest Holding Apple a Warning for Wall Street?
text: The billionaire has proven his knowledge of stocks and the market over time.

title: Can Apple Intelligence live up to its hype?
text: Apple's (AAPL) earnings bring Apple Intelligence into focus as the iPhone maker rolls out its artificial intelligence (AI) features, hoping to drive an accelerated device upgrade cycle. Creative Strategies CEO and principal analyst Ben Bajarin joins Market Domination Hosts Julie Hyman and Josh Lipton to discuss the balancing act Apple needs to perform in building excitement around Apple Intelligence to drive upgrades while not overpromising and disappointing users.

title: Apple Will Invest $1.5 Billion In Globalstar To Expand Satellite Services
text: The tech company is pledging more money for Globalstar's network of satellites, which power Emergency SOS and messaging.

title: Breaking Down Magnificent 7 Earnings Results
text: Of the six members of ‘The Magnificent 7' group of stocks that have reported September-quarter results already, the market didn't like three – Apple AAPL, Microsoft MSFT, and Meta META – but loved the Tesla TSLA report and liked what it saw from Alphabet GOOGL and Amazon AMZN.

title: Report: Investors Remain Uncertain About Apple AI Features' Impact on Sales
text: Apple shares dipped early Friday (Nov. 1) as investors remained uncertain about the prospects for the company's rollout of artificial intelligence features. Apple gave guidance Thursday (Oct.

title: Stock Market This Week: AAPL, AMZN, MSFT Earnings Reports, SMCI's Stunning Sell-Off
text: A turbulent week led by Mega Cap earnings closed down for all indices aside from the RUT. Mixed bag reports from the Mag 7 giants were partly responsible for the end-of-week results.

title: Stock Market Today: Dow Climbs 288 Points After Amazon, Intel Earnings
text: Post-earnings strength from Amazon and Intel helped cushion the blow of a disappointing October jobs report.

title: Apple's stock will be range-bound through year-end, says Morgan Stanley's Erik Woodring
text: Erik Woodring, Morgan Stanley Apple analyst, joins 'Closing Bell' to discuss Apple earnings and outlook.

title: Apple's Tepid Forecast, China Weakness Spark Concern
text: Apple, heading into its most critical sales period of the year, sparked fresh concerns about revenue growth and lingering weakness in an intensely competitive China market. Deepwater Asset Management Managing Partner Gene Munster joins Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow to discuss on "Bloomberg Technology.

title: Capitalize on Apple & Amazon Earnings With These ETFs
text: With uncertainty swirling around overconcentration in mega-cap tech companies, investors are closely monitoring quarterly earnings.  Yesterday, both Apple and Amazon released their quarterly earnings.

title: AAPL Intelligence Success Needed to "Keep Stock from Crashing"
text: David Trainer expects good news for Apple (AAPL) to already be priced into the stock. According to him, there's not much upside left for Apple to climb unless it can show big wins in Apple Intelligence.

title: Crude Oil Moves Higher; Apple Shares Slide After Q4 Results
text: U.S. stocks traded higher toward the end of trading, with the Nasdaq Composite gaining more than 100 points on Friday.

title: Apple is buying photo editing app Pixelmator
text: Pixelmator Friday announced that it is being acquired by Apple. The image editing platform didn't discuss what life might look like under the corporate umbrella, but did note that would be “no material changes” to its Pixelmator Pro, Pixelmator for iOS, and Photomator apps – at least for now.

title: Apple's China headache isn't going away anytime soon
text: Apple missed sales estimates in Greater China last quarter. Greater China is a key market for Apple, with new AI features expected to roll out in April.

title: Apple Tops Q4 Earnings & Revenue Estimates: Buy, Sell or Hold Shares?
text: AAPL's fourth-quarter fiscal 2024 results benefit from strong services growth. However, modest growth prospects should keep investors on the sidelines.

title: If You'd Invested $1,000 in Apple Stock 10 Years Ago, Here's How Much You'd Have Today
text: Apple has delivered incredible returns for long-term investors.

title: Apple to buy Pixelmator, the iPhone image editing app with AI features
text: Apple will buy Pixelmator, the creators of image editing apps for Apple's iPhone and Mac platforms, Pixelmator announced on Friday in a blog post. Apple has highlighted Pixelmator apps over the years in its keynote product launches.

title: Apple Q4 Results 'Better-Than-Feared': Analysts Highlight iPhone 16 Demand, Apple Intelligence Opportunity After 'Rock Solid Quarter'
text: Apple Inc AAPL beat analysts' fourth-quarter revenue and earnings estimates, but guidance that came in below estimates has analysts questioning the future outlook after Thursday's report.

title: Apple's conversative sales guidance allows for beat driven by strong margins, analysts say
text: Apple Inc (NASDAQ:AAPL, ETR:APC)'s conservative revenue guidance for the December quarter is an opportunity for a modest beat, analysts at Bank of America believe. The iPhone maker's guidance suggests sales will grow by the low to mid-single digits during the holiday quarter, short of the 7% growth expected by Wall Street analysts.

title: Apple stock declines as iPhone demand raises concerns
text: Apple (AAPL) shares are trading lower after the iPhone maker reported quarterly results with revenue beating expectations as earnings fell short due to European Union tax costs. The company's sales outlook came in weaker than expected, contributing to investors' disappointment.

title: Apple Stock Sinks On Disappointing Sales Outlook
text: Apple stock retreated Friday after the consumer electronics giant offered weak sales guidance for the December quarter. The post Apple Stock Sinks On Disappointing Sales Outlook appeared first on Investor's Business Daily.

title: Apple to invest up to $1.5 bln in Globalstar for satellite coverage expansion
text: Apple will invest up to $1.5 billion in Globalstar to fund the expansion of its iPhone communication services, the satellite provider said in a regulatory filing on Friday.

title: Apple Reports Record Q4 iPhone Sales but Stock Dips: ETFs in Focus
text: Apple beats revenue and earnings estimates and reports record iPhone sales. However, sales fall in China.

title: Dan Ives Is bullish on Microsoft, Optimistic on Apple
text: Wedbush Securities senior equity analyst Dan Ives explains why he's "even more bullish" on big tech stocks on the heels of underwhelming forecasts from Microsoft and Meta Platforms, and ahead of the latest quarterly results from Apple and Amazon. Dan speaks with Tom Keene and Paul Sweeney on Bloomberg Radio.

title: Apple & Nvidia in Dogfight for Largest Market Cap
text: Apple and Nvidia appear to be in a proverbial dogfight for the top spot for the largest company based on market capitalization. Once again, the theme of artificial intelligence (AI) will play a major role in deciding the victor.

text: Apple stock is trading lower Friday despite the iPhone maker beating expectations for its fiscal fourth quarter, but analysts are still bullish.

title: Apple commits $1.5 billion to Globalstar for expanded iPhone satellite services
text: Apple committed about $1.5 billion to satellite communications company Globalstar to fund the expansion of iPhone services. The tech giant has already been spending hundreds of millions for Globlastar services, which enabled the 2022 rollout of iPhone emergency satellite texting.

text: Ivan Feinseth is bullish on Apple (AAPL) despite some disappointment in its latest earnings report. He believes the A.I.

text: Apple's (NASDAQ: AAPL) share price has slipped since the company released its Q3 2024 earnings, with concerns about its revenue forecast seeming to impact the stock.

title: Opinion: Apple Stock Will Hit $4 Trillion by 2025
text: Despite the market getting spooked on Halloween causing the Nasdaq exchange to plunge 512 points, or 2.8%, on tech stocks getting routed, Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL) stock fared slightly better after earnings. It dropped only 1.8%, but that should be a temporary situation.

title: JD.com, Alibaba Stocks Rise Ahead of Key China Meeting. It's a Big Deal for Apple, Too.
text: It's not just Chinese companies that will be eagerly awaiting an announcement on stimulus.

title: AAPL Earnings Show Early Signs of iPhone Supercycle
text: Oppenheimer's Martin Yang points to Apple's (AAPL) iPhone sales topping $46 billion and growing sales in China as signs of the company's tech dominance. He believes Apple's supercycle is still intact, expecting the average consumer to buy its new model, despite the company's sluggish rollout of Apple Intelligence.

title: Analysts revise Apple stock price target
text: Apple's (NASDAQ: AAPL) latest earnings report can best be described as chaotic. The company announced strong iPhone sales figures overall but also revealed lacking demand in China and a major one-time net income hit from an E.U.

title: Apple Earnings - When Really Good Just Isn't Good Enough
text: Apple Inc. NASDAQ: AAPL delivered a double-beat in its quarterly earnings, including posting a record quarter for iPhone sales revenue. However, AAPL stock dropped over 1% following the report.

title: Globalstar Stock Jumps 58% After Agreement With Apple
text: The satellite company will deliver expanded services to Apple over a new mobile services network, the company said Friday.

text: Mizuho's Jordan Klein and TD Cowen's Andrew Sherman discuss the key takeaways, positive and negative, from Apple and Amazon's latest earnings, and highlight other tech names on their radar.

title: Apple irks the Street with holiday season guidance
text: Apple Inc's (NASDAQ:AAPL, ETR:APC) stock fell 2% on Thursday and is expected to open in negative terrtory after the company offered cautious guidance for the upcoming holiday quarter, expressing uncertainty about how new AI features will impact device sales. The forecast for low to mid-single-digit revenue growth this quarter slightly missed Wall Street's higher estimates.
